explanation: Correct. The _MHD_EXTERN macro expands to __attribute__((visibility("default"))) extern, and __attribute__ is a GCC/Clang compiler-specific language extension (not standard C). MISRA C:2023 Rule 1.2 forbids use of language extensions unless those extensions are explicitly documented/managed as compiler extensions; hiding the attribute in a macro does not remove the use of the extension. Therefore the report of a Rule 1.2 violation is valid. (To remediate, conditionally define the macro only when the compiler documents/supports the attribute or provide a standard extern-only definition for other compilers.)
